results.title: Synchro systems. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Burton Holmes Films and United States. Navy. Bureau of Aeronautics
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Radio Technician Training”
Shows the operation of a control transformer and a differential synchro generator; explains how to use a control transformer as a receiver and a diferential synchro generator when putting corrections into the signal of the circuit.

results.title: Synchro systems. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Burton Holmes Films and United States. Navy. Bureau of Aeronautics
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Radio Technician Training”
Shows how orders from a ship’s telegraph on the bridge are transmitted electrically to a dial in the engine room. Discusses in detail the operations of the two major components in the system, the synchro generator and the synchro motor.

results.title: Symphony of life
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India and N. Shantaram
results.brief_description: Initiating a new trend in films produced by Documentary Films of India, “Symphony of Life” is a blend of music and image without spoken commentary. Through the visuals, the film brings into focus the most immediate and significant theme of our time - the struggle and the triumph of man over the destructive forces of nature and our hopes and aspirations for a better tomorrow. Musical score by V. Shirali, recorded by P. K. Vishwanath. Images by T. A. Abraham edited by N. D. Keluskar.

results.title: Symphonies in stone: Lincoln Cathedral
results.brief_description: Lincoln Cathedral stands on a site chosen by the Romans and is one of England’s oldest and greatest cathedrals. The film includes external and internal views of the cathedral; details of Norman arches; 13th century rose windows; 14th century stone screen and wooden choir stalls; 15th century angel carvings.

results.title: Symphonies in stone. No. 3. Salisbury Cathedral
results.brief_description: The foundation stones of the cathedral at New Sarum, the present-day Salisbury were laid on 28 April 1220. Completed and consecrated in 1258, Salisbury Cathedral is the finest example of early English ecclesiastical architecture in Britain. The film includes exterior and interior views of the cathedral - the nave, transepts, choir, High Altar and Lady Chapel, the close, cloisters, chapter house, clock and 404 ft spire. Music and commentary by Horace Shepherd.

results.title: Symphonie mechanique
results.creator_credit: Argos Films, Anatole Dauman, P.H. Lifchitz and Jean Mitry
results.brief_description: In this short experimental piece, Jean Mitry combined shots of industrial machinery with a contemporary score creating a poetic rhythm between image and sound featuring a score by French composer Pierre Boulez entitled ‘Musique Concrete’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Argos Films, Anatole Dauman, P.H. Lifchitz and Jean Mitry

results.title: Symmetry
results.brief_description: This animated visual imagery consists of semi-abstract figures in constant motion. The arrangements and movements of the figures in constant motion. The arrangements and movements of the figures displaying symmetries and, by implication, defining symmetry elements, developed in controlled progression from simple to more complex symmetries. Throughout, the figures obey strict mathematical principles.

results.title: Symmetries of the cube (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Allen Downs
results.brief_description: Studies the octahedial group (symmetries of the cube and the octahedron) via reflections. Various sub-groups are determined by examining the reflections in three pairs of mirrors of the kaleidoscope. Shows how the construction of kaleidoscopes is related to the cube and the octahedron.
results.description: Studies the octahedial group (symmetries of the cube and the octahedron) via reflections. results.title: Symbolism in literature
results.creator_credit: Sigma Education Films, Herb Schick, Noel Korn and Herman Epstein
results.brief_description: The basic theories of symbolism are discussed as an introduction. Edgar Allen Poe’s chilling story, “The Tell Tale Heart”, helps us to uncover symbols and their meanings, enhancing our enjoyment and understanding of fiction. Also briefly discusses symbolism in Van Gogh’s work. Uses animation to accompany Poe’s story.

results.title: Symbolism and luxury: the new century 1897-1911
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and David Muir
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
The Spirit of the Plains (10min): Painted in 1897, this is one of Sydney Long’s finest pieces of work. Endormies: A painting by Rupert Bunny. The Mother (9min): Examines the range and quality of artist George Lambert’s best work. The Ferry (8min): This painting is the sunniest and most lyrical of E. Phillips Fox’s paintings.
